info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:58PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Douglas, northwestern Lake and northwestern Klamath Counties through 330 PM PDT... At 257 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Digit Point Campground At Miller Lake, or 30 miles north of Crater Lake, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crescent, Digit Point Campground At Miller Lake and Gilchrist. This includes the following highways... US 97 in Oregon between mile markers 174 and 199. Highway 31 in Oregon between mile markers 3 and 22. Highway 58 in Oregon between mile markers 75 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
